This curriculum is designed for a 5-year-old child who already knows phonics and can blend 2–3 letter
words. The focus is on improving vocabulary, sentence building, comprehension, and speaking
confidence.

--- CURRICULUM OUTPUT (generated by AI Agent — Silver Cycle 2026-02-22) ---

English Curriculum — Early Learner (Age 5)
Entry Level: Knows phonics, can blend CVC (2–3 letter) words
Duration: 12 weeks

MODULE 1 — Vocabulary Expansion (Weeks 1–3)
  Week 1 | Animals & Habitats | 10 target words | flashcard matching
  Week 2 | Food & Meals       | 10 target words | grocery role-play
  Week 3 | Feelings & Emotions| 10 target words | emotion mirror game
  Goal: Recognise and use 30 topic words in spoken sentences.

MODULE 2 — Sentence Building (Weeks 4–6)
  Week 4 | Subject + Verb (2-word sentences)
  Week 5 | Subject + Verb + Object (3-word sentences)
  Week 6 | Subject + Verb + Object + Place/Time (full sentences)
  Goal: Build and write 4–5 word grammatically correct sentences independently.

MODULE 3 — Reading Comprehension (Weeks 7–9)
  Week 7 | Simple decodable readers → Who, What, Where questions
  Week 8 | Level 1 picture books → sequencing (first/next/last)
  Week 9 | Short paragraphs → main idea + 1 supporting detail
  Goal: Answer 3 comprehension questions after one reading.

MODULE 4 — Speaking Confidence (Weeks 10–12)
  Week 10 | Show & Tell — 3+ sentences unprompted
  Week 11 | Story retelling with sequence words
  Week 12 | Mini presentation (5 sentences, eye contact, clear voice)
  Goal: Speak for 30+ seconds on a chosen topic.
